scenes.background: You are leading a project team that has just received an urgent assignment requiring a significant amount of work to be completed within a tight deadline. The team is feeling a lot of pressure, and morale is low, with some members showing signs of frustration and anxiety. One of the team members, Alex, says, 'This is impossible! We can't get this done in time.' You responded by suggesting breaking the tasks into smaller parts. The team seemed somewhat relieved but still on edge. [Monica] and [Bob] exchange concerned looks. Monica then speaks up, 'Even with smaller tasks, the deadline is still too tight.' Bob, looking frustrated, adds, 'I don't think anyone here believes we can actually pull this off.' You encouraged the team to stay focused and work together, showing good self-regulation and motivational skills. Monica and Bob still seem unconvinced. Monica crosses her arms and says, 'I just don't see how this is going to work.' Bob looks at you, exasperated, 'Are we really going to keep pushing everyone this hard?' You suggested reassessing the approach and redistributing the tasks. Monica and Bob are now discussing the new plan with you. Monica sighs and says, 'Even with the new plan, I'm not sure everyone will be on board.' Bob, looking a bit more hopeful but still skeptical, asks, 'What if some team members just can't handle the pressure?' You emphasized communication and mutual support, demonstrating good self-regulation and motivational skills. Monica nods slowly but still looks doubtful. Bob frowns and says, 'But what if the pressure gets to be too much for some of us?'
scenes.description: Monica, looking more worried than before, says, 'We can't afford to have anyone burn out.'

options.text: We need to keep an eye on each other and step in if someone looks like they're struggling.
options.analysis: You emphasized the importance of mutual support and vigilance, showing strong empathy and social skills.

options.text: I get that it's tough, but we have to stay strong and give it our all. We can take breaks as needed.
options.analysis: You acknowledged the difficulty but encouraged resilience, showing good self-regulation and motivational skills.

options.text: If anyone feels like they can't handle it, they should let us know now. We need to push through and get this done.
options.analysis: You called for transparency and determination, showing moderate social skills and motivation, though empathy was less emphasized.
